name: Move/Sprint
description:
Move within one range band (Close Range).

While moving, if you do any actions you will take a -1 to all rolls because of it. If using AC0 armor, this is negated.

 You can also Sprint up to two range bands (Medium Range) at a blistering pace.

You can do actions while sprinting, but not too well. you suffer a -2 to all actions while sprinting. If using AC0 armor, this is reduced to -1.

name: Double Time
description:
Consume your standard action for another turn of movement, allowing you to move in a deadsprint towards a destination.

 Can only do bonus actions once you arrive to your destination- and with a -2 malus.

name: Prone/Mount
description:
Get supine/on your belly or mount your rifle on some cover. 

 While prone or mounted, you gain a +1 bonus to all shooting rolls. While prone specifically, you get a +1 bonus to stealth rolls if moving, or a +1 bonus to disguise if still. When prone or mounted, you cannot move to sprint immediately, but can just move normally.

 You make little noise while prone, and can easily sneak under vehicles and into vents if need be.

 However, you also suffer a -3 to all [CQC] and [Melee] rolls, and a -2 to all movement related rolls [Acrobatics] in both stances.

name: Flank
description:
Move to flank someone. 

 When flanking, it needs to be declared in advance. As such, you suffer a malus depending on distance travelled to all actions done while flanking per movement rules. However- when flanking a target or a piece of cover, you negate any cover bonuses they may have. 

To determine if a target is being flanked, draw imaginary lines from the hex faces of adjacent cover outwards of the target. If the shooter is in hexes behind those lines, then they are considered being flanked.
